channel.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
channel.description:
Which types of music do you think is better? Ranging from heavier stylings of Metal, Grunge and Punk. To the softer laid back music from country and blues. Or the popular upbeat music?
I tend to listen to all typs of music, although heavy metal has always been my favorite pack of genres. Iron Maiden was my first real concert back in 2006 and it was the best concert so far (Followed by Ozzy Osbourne 2 months later)
What music do you think is the better music?

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: SoaringScout
item.description:
Heavy. To me that includes: Bring Me The Horizon, Attack! Attack!, Blessthefall, Etc etc. Just bands that no one has ever heard of. Makes me feel like one of the “emo” people that brag about how that know bands that aren’t very popular. Only I choose not to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Bolteh:

It might just be easier to post all the artists I own at least one full album of (generally meaning: I really like them). So no random bands and songs I like to listen to, but not worthy to get a whole album.

My artist list from iTunes goooooooes like this:
ARTISTS

None of you want to see all the artists I own music from- it’d break the internetz.

EDIT:
WHOAH

Bolteh:


Led Zeppelin (some late 60s-70s Britland band that nobody ever heard of)

Bolteh:


Led Zeppelin … band that nobody ever heard of

Bolteh:

[COLOR=‘Red’]
Led Zeppelin

:hmph:

I take that as an insult to teh Zeppelin. I am disappoint.

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: Android11x
item.description:
I’m gunna have to say soft because I am with classic rock. If I can get away with heavy being techno and rave then yes, heavy. Most kinds of rock and techno. Slayer is like the only band I like that’s really metal, err… hard rockish.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
That doesn’t mean their music can’t be released on albums, you douche :hmph:

Also,

Burbinator:

Alexandre Levy; Edvard Grieg; Glenn Branca; Philip Glass; Reginald R. Robinson; Wim Mertens;

I just copy-pasted this from my foobar2000 library, awesome. I know it’s annoying to read, but meh.

Reginald Robinson is mostly ragtime, but since you included that into ‘classical,’ why shouldn’t I :retard:

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Bolteh:

Nah, I didn’t actually quote it, I copy-pasted it :<

quote (kwt)
v. quot·ed, quot·ing, quotes
v.tr.

  1. To repeat or copy the words of (another), usually with acknowledgment of the source.
  2. To cite or refer to for illustration or proof.
  3. To repeat a brief passage or excerpt from: The saxophonist quoted a Duke Ellington melody in his solo.
  4. To state (a price) for securities, goods, or services.

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
CTID:

Please tell me that is a horrible joke.

sar·casm
Pronunciation: \ˈsär-ˌka-zəm
Function: noun
Etymology: French or Late Latin; French sarcasme, from Late Latin sarcasmos, from Greek sarkasmos, from sarkazein to tear flesh, bite the lips in rage, sneer, from sark-, sarx flesh; probably akin to Avestan thwarəs- to cut
Date: 1550

1 : a sharp and often satirical or ironic utterance designed to cut or give pain
2 a : a mode of satirical wit depending for its effect on bitter, caustic, and often ironic language that is usually directed against an individual b : the use or language of sarcasm

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy, Soft or Popular?
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
megiddo:

I happen to like cannibal corpse, whenever i happen to listen to it, like on a nice picnic or a day at the beach, it just makes me feel cool, calm and collected. Its like having Mozart there playing a classical note into your ear and telling you all the things that you’d like to hear.

Read full topic
